title: Grim Evidence of Trump’s Boat Strikes Washes Ashore on a Colombian Peninsula
summary: First came the scorched boat. Then the mangled bodies. Then the packets with traces of marijuana. Now, fishermen fear the ocean that feeds them.

title: More Kennedy Center Performances Are Canceled After Trump’s Renaming
summary: A dance company withdrew from two performances next year, and the arts center’s website says two New Year’s Eve jazz concerts have been canceled.

title: Trump Says the U.S. Struck a ‘Big Facility’ in Campaign Against Venezuela
summary: The administration provided no details of what the president said was an attack last week linked to U.S. efforts to disrupt drug trafficking from Latin America.

title: Israel Strips U.N. Agency for Palestinian Refugees of Diplomatic Immunity
summary: The legislation was the latest blow to the agency, known as UNRWA. Israel has accused it of being extensively infiltrated by Hamas.

title: Iran’s Currency Collapse Pushes Protesters to the Streets
summary: High inflation and a currency collapse have squeezed Iranians’ budgets, challenging the country’s leaders.

title: Russia Threatens to Toughen Its Stance on Ending the War in Ukraine
summary: Moscow said a Ukrainian drone attack targeted a residence of President Vladimir V. Putin, which Ukraine denied, accusing the Kremlin of fabricating an excuse not to make peace.

title: For Zelensky, Just Keeping Trump Talking About Ukraine Peace Deal Counts as a Win
summary: Though discussions produced little tangible progress, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at least avoided the type of setbacks that have blighted earlier meetings.

title: Inside Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Break With Trump and MAGA
summary: How the Georgia congresswoman went from the president’s loudest cheerleader to his loudest Republican critic.

title: Four Takeaways From the New York Times Profile of Marjorie Taylor Greene
summary: The congresswoman discussed her break with President Trump and her journey from MAGA zealot to political isolation.

title: Claire Brosseau Wants to Die. Will Canada Let Her?
summary: Ms. Brosseau says mental illness has made her life unbearable. She wants a medically assisted death. Even her psychiatrists are split over whether she should have one.

title: Mamdani Will Be Sworn In at Abandoned Subway Station Beneath City Hall
summary: Hours before Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani holds an inauguration block party outside City Hall, he will officially become mayor in a small private ceremony.

title: As Mamdani Leaves Queens for the Upper East Side, a Cool Welcome Awaits
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani loves his Astoria, Queens, neighborhood, and the feeling is mutual. But voters who live near Gracie Mansion, his new home, really wanted his opponent to win.

title: The New Billionaires of the A.I. Boom
summary: Just like past tech booms, the latest frenzy has produced a group of billionaires — at least on paper — from smaller start-ups.

title: As Youth Sports Professionalize, Kids Are Burning Out Fast
summary: A growing body of research shows how pressure from overbearing coaches and parents is stunting children’s emotional well-being and leading to injuries.

title: 10 Fitness Tips to Help You Get Moving in 2026
summary: Turn your walk into a better workout, build strength without weights and more exercise advice for the year ahead.

title: Who Says Rock Is Dead?
summary: In 2025, rock was still hanging in. As artificial intelligence infiltrates music, the genre’s handmade imperfections are more crucial than ever.

title: A Bold Alliance Ends as Innovative Opera Director Bows Out in Detroit
summary: Yuval Sharon will leave the financially strained Detroit Opera after this season. In March, he brings his unorthodox vision to Wagner at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: One of America’s Most Successful Experiments Is Coming to a Shuddering Halt
summary: Amid an astonishing wave of anti-Indian animus, Indian Americans are questioning their place in the country.

title: A Love Letter to My Dutch Oven
summary: How a piece of kitchen equipment watched me grow up.

title: Russia Threatens to Harden Its Stance on Ukraine
summary: Plus, food trends for 2026. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Idris Elba and Cynthia Erivo Make King Charles’s New Year Honors List
summary: Mr. Elba received a knighthood and Ms. Erivo was also honored in an annual British tradition celebrating professional excellence and community service.

title: Uber Flags Sexual Misconduct but Many Drivers Stay on the Road
summary: The company monitors passenger feedback for risky driver behavior. Some accused of serious sexual assault had prior records of complaints.

title: Ice Storm Makes Travel Dangerous in Parts of New York and New England
summary: Officials in Vermont and Buffalo, N.Y., warned residents to stay off the roads as a winter weather system brought thick sheets of ice and snow. Tens of thousands of power customers faced outages.
